metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5715 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution and indirectbranch prediction may allow unauthorized disclosure of information to anattacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5715` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-141-generic - 3.13.0-141.190
linux-image-3.13.0-141-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-141.190
linux-image-3.13.0-141-lowlatency - 3.13.0-141.190

linux-image-3.13.0-141-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-141.190
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-141-generic - 3.13.0-141.190
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-141.190').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was pending').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-111.134~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1011.11').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
qemu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.38').
libvirt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.2-0ubuntu13.1.25').
intel-microcode package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20180312.0~ubuntu14.04.1').
amd64-microcode package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20180524.1~ubuntu0.14.04.1').
firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0.4+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
